trans-unit.source: Creates an uncompressed device-independent bitmap (DIB) with the specified width, height, and color depth

seg-source.mrk: Creates an uncompressed device-independent bitmap (DIB) with the specified width, height, and color depth

target.mrk: Creates an uncompressed device-independent bitmap (DIB) with the specified width, height, and color depth

trans-unit.source: Parameters

seg-source.mrk: Parameters

target.mrk: Parameters

trans-unit.source: The width of the bitmap, in pixels.

seg-source.mrk: The width of the bitmap, in pixels.

target.mrk: The width of the bitmap, in pixels.

trans-unit.source: The height of the bitmap, in pixels. If this value is positive, the bitmap is a bottom-up DIB and its origin is the lower-left corner, otherwise, the bitmap is a top-down DIB and its origin is the upper-left corner.

seg-source.mrk: The height of the bitmap, in pixels.
If this value is positive, the bitmap is a bottom-up DIB and its origin is the lower-left corner, otherwise, the bitmap is a top-down DIB and its origin is the upper-left corner.

target.mrk: The height of the bitmap, in pixels.
If this value is positive, the bitmap is a bottom-up DIB and its origin is the lower-left corner, otherwise, the bitmap is a top-down DIB and its origin is the upper-left corner.

trans-unit.source: [optional] The number of bits that define each pixel and the maximum number of colors in the bitmap. Default is 32.

seg-source.mrk: [optional]
The number of bits that define each pixel and the maximum number of colors in the bitmap.
Default is 32.

target.mrk: [optional]
The number of bits that define each pixel and the maximum number of colors in the bitmap.
Default is 32.

trans-unit.source: [optional] "dword[n]" structure that represents a DIB color table.

seg-source.mrk: [optional]
"dword[n]" structure that represents a DIB color table.

target.mrk: [optional]
"dword[n]" structure that represents a DIB color table.

trans-unit.source: The number of colors in this table depends on the values of the $iBitsPerPel parameters.

seg-source.mrk: The number of colors in this table depends on the values of the $iBitsPerPel parameters.

target.mrk: The number of colors in this table depends on the values of the $iBitsPerPel parameters.

trans-unit.source: [optional] The number of color indexes in the DIB color table that are actually used by the bitmap.

seg-source.mrk: [optional]
The number of color indexes in the DIB color table that are actually used by the bitmap.

target.mrk: [optional]
The number of color indexes in the DIB color table that are actually used by the bitmap.

trans-unit.source: The value of this parameter should not exceed the number of colors in the color table pointed to by the $pColorTable parameter. Default is 0.

seg-source.mrk: The value of this parameter should not exceed the number of colors in the color table pointed to by the $pColorTable parameter.
Default is 0.

target.mrk: The value of this parameter should not exceed the number of colors in the color table pointed to by the $pColorTable parameter.
Default is 0.

trans-unit.source: Return Value

seg-source.mrk: Return Value

target.mrk: Return Value

trans-unit.source: Handle to the DIB.

seg-source.mrk: Handle to the DIB.

target.mrk: Handle to the DIB.

trans-unit.source: 0 and sets the @error flag to non-zero.

seg-source.mrk: 0 and sets the @error flag to non-zero.

target.mrk: 0 and sets the @error flag to non-zero.

trans-unit.source: Remarks

seg-source.mrk: Remarks

target.mrk: Remarks

trans-unit.source: If the bitmap is monochrome (1 bits-per-pixel), the color table should contain two entries.

seg-source.mrk: If the bitmap is monochrome (1 bits-per-pixel), the color table should contain two entries.

target.mrk: If the bitmap is monochrome (1 bits-per-pixel), the color table should contain two entries.

trans-unit.source: If the color table is not specified, the function creates a monochrome bitmap with black and white colors. If the bitmap use 4 or 8 bits-per-pixel, the color table should contain up to 16 or 256 entries respectively.

seg-source.mrk: If the color table is not specified, the function creates a monochrome bitmap with black and white colors.
If the bitmap use 4 or 8 bits-per-pixel, the color table should contain up to 16 or 256 entries respectively.

target.mrk: If the color table is not specified, the function creates a monochrome bitmap with black and white colors.
If the bitmap use 4 or 8 bits-per-pixel, the color table should contain up to 16 or 256 entries respectively.

trans-unit.source: In this case, if the color table is not specified, the function creates an empty color table (all colors is black) with the maximum possible number of entries for the specified color depth.

seg-source.mrk: In this case, if the color table is not specified, the function creates an empty color table (all colors is black) with the maximum possible number of entries for the specified color depth.

target.mrk: In this case, if the color table is not specified, the function creates an empty color table (all colors is black) with the maximum possible number of entries for the specified color depth.

trans-unit.source: You can fill out this color table later by using the _WinAPI_SetDIBColorTable() function.

seg-source.mrk: You can fill out this color table later by using the _WinAPI_SetDIBColorTable() function.

target.mrk: You can fill out this color table later by using the _WinAPI_SetDIBColorTable() function.

trans-unit.source: If the bitmap use 16, 24, or 32 bits-per-pixel, the color table is not used, and $tColorTable parameter is ignored.

seg-source.mrk: If the bitmap use 16, 24, or 32 bits-per-pixel, the color table is not used, and $tColorTable parameter is ignored.

target.mrk: If the bitmap use 16, 24, or 32 bits-per-pixel, the color table is not used, and $tColorTable parameter is ignored.

trans-unit.source: This function does not create a compressed 16, 24, or 32 bits-per-pixel bitmaps, that is the "biCompression" member of $tagBITMAPINFO structure is always 0 ($BI_RGB).

seg-source.mrk: This function does not create a compressed 16, 24, or 32 bits-per-pixel bitmaps, that is the "biCompression" member of $tagBITMAPINFO structure is always 0 ($BI_RGB).

target.mrk: This function does not create a compressed 16, 24, or 32 bits-per-pixel bitmaps, that is the "biCompression" member of $tagBITMAPINFO structure is always 0 ($BI_RGB).

trans-unit.source: When you are finished using the bitmap, destroy it using the _WinAPI_DeleteObject() function.

seg-source.mrk: When you are finished using the bitmap, destroy it using the _WinAPI_DeleteObject() function.

target.mrk: When you are finished using the bitmap, destroy it using the _WinAPI_DeleteObject() function.

trans-unit.source: Call _WinAPI_GetExtended() to retrieve a pointer to the location of the DIB bit values.

seg-source.mrk: Call _WinAPI_GetExtended() to retrieve a pointer to the location of the DIB bit values.

target.mrk: Call _WinAPI_GetExtended() to retrieve a pointer to the location of the DIB bit values.
